result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah Dejour Hudgins

records.addlTxt:
Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Isaiah Dejour Hudgins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Isaiah Dejour Hudgins.  Attorney Owen M. Piotrowski on behalf of Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Scheduling Conference proceeded.

Defendant entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. 
EXPIRES DECEMBER 12, 2022.

Defendant Isaiah Dejour Hudgins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Isaiah Dejour Hudgins.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided an update to the Court and requested an adjournment. State did not object. Court granted Defense request. Case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing, Branch 46. State to comply with Victim Notification. Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 11:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Hanrahan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Feiss, Br. 46.

Defendant Isaiah Dejour Hudgins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Isaiah Dejour Hudgins.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective E. Fitting. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Thomas J.W.; Daniel M.C.; David M.C.; Nyriah A.C.; Pamela K.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Isaiah Dejour Hudgins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes appeared by video for Isaiah Dejour Hudgins.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K WARRANT
